## Description {#details}

Provides some synthesis utilities to produce sequences of values.

The names are intentionally kept very short as they tend to occur in common and widely used contexts.

The <code>seq(A, B)</code> function produces a sequence of values from <code>A</code> to up to (but not including) <code>B</code>, i.e., &#91;<code>A</code>, <code>B</code>), that can be safely iterated over. <code>seq</code> supports both integral (e.g., <code>int</code>, <code>char</code>, <code>uint32&#95;t</code>) and enum types. <code>seq&#95;inclusive(A, B)</code> produces a sequence of values from <code>A</code> to <code>B</code>, including <code>B</code>.

Examples with integral types: 
<ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> x : <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#adc4eb8be6f7a12ede962987fb9cabb47">seq</a>(0, 3))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a2d79a00fa7c56f57b87f2fe2a3f118c7">outs</a>() &lt;&lt; <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/m68k/#ab3a288f2953d8eca3e363959fc2cf38ea9dd4e461268c8034f5c8564e155c67a6">x</a> &lt;&lt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot; &quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>

Prints: <code>0 1 2 </code>.


<ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> x : <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a0c2ddf6dc4989447e45dca1bbbe8fc68">seq&#95;inclusive</a>(0, 3))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a2d79a00fa7c56f57b87f2fe2a3f118c7">outs</a>() &lt;&lt; <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/m68k/#ab3a288f2953d8eca3e363959fc2cf38ea9dd4e461268c8034f5c8564e155c67a6">x</a> &lt;&lt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot; &quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>

Prints: <code>0 1 2 3 </code>.

Similar to <code>seq</code> and <code>seq&#95;inclusive</code>, the <code>enum&#95;seq</code> and <code>enum&#95;seq&#95;inclusive</code> functions produce sequences of enum values that can be iterated over. To enable iteration with enum types, you need to either mark enums as safe to iterate on by specializing <code>enum&#95;iteration&#95;traits</code>, or opt into potentially unsafe iteration at every callsite by passing <code>force&#95;iteration&#95;on&#95;noniterable&#95;enum</code>.

Examples with enum types:

<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#96;is&#95;iterable&#96; set to &#96;true&#96; in the &#96;llvm&#96; namespace.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Alternatively, you can pass the &#96;force&#95;iteration&#95;on&#95;noniterable&#95;enum&#96; tag</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to &#96;enum&#95;seq&#96; or &#96;enum&#95;seq&#95;inclusive&#96;.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/enum-iteration-traits"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">template</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> EnumT&gt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/enum-iteration-traits">enum&#95;iteration&#95;traits</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00329" /><CodeLine lineNumber="329"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Iterate over an enum type from Begin up to - but not including - End.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00330" /><CodeLine lineNumber="330"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Note: &#96;enum&#95;seq&#96; will generate each consecutive value, even if no</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00331" /><CodeLine lineNumber="331"><Highlight kind="comment">/// enumerator with that value exists.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00332" /><CodeLine lineNumber="332"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Note: Begin and End values have to be within &#91;INTMAX&#95;MIN, INTMAX&#95;MAX&#93; for</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00343" /><CodeLine lineNumber="343"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Iterate over an enum type from Begin up to - but not including - End, even</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00344" /><CodeLine lineNumber="344"><Highlight kind="comment">/// when &#96;EnumT&#96; is not marked as safely iterable by &#96;enum&#95;iteration&#95;traits&#96;.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00345" /><CodeLine lineNumber="345"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Note: &#96;enum&#95;seq&#96; will generate each consecutive value, even if no</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00346" /><CodeLine lineNumber="346"><Highlight kind="comment">/// enumerator with that value exists.</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00350" /><CodeLine lineNumber="350"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">template</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> EnumT,</Highlight></CodeLine>
